User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Build ID: 20110615151330

Steps to reproduce:

have at least two mails in your inbox (or maybe other folder) with the second mail bearing the status flag "unread".
open latest mail (latest on top) of the inbox list.
after reader window has opened click back on list window.
move the mail in question to an archive folder (e.g. by drag and drop).


Actual results:

the first mail moved to the archive folder.
the second mail got highlighted in the list view.
the second mail got flagged as "read" - this is half of the bug.
the second mail replaced the first mail in the external mail reader.


Expected results:

the first mail should stay open in the mail reader.
the second mail should not get opened or altered in any way.

comments.text: How do you sort your mailbox ?
comments.raw_text: How do you sort your mailbox ?

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:36.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/36.0

The same problem exists in the latest version of Thunderbird as of 25/02/2015
Move any e-mail, that is already open in a New Tab, using drag and drop to a different folder.
The e-mail open in the New tab changes to the next mail in the list.
The mail is sorted by date descending order (newest date at top).

It appears that the reference to the mail used when opening the New tab is a sequence number in a list.

i.e open 3rd email in list, move 3rd e-mail to any other folder (Drag & Drop), the 3rd email in the list is now the next in the sequence and the previously opened New tab updates itself to be the new 3rd email)

Apologies if the terminology is incorrect.
